review_title: Good place to work but low pay
pros: Nice place to work, not too much workload, and fair tenure requirement. Collaborative working culture. Excellent immigration policy & support.
cons: Pay range is low in comparison to other equivalent schools nearby. Salary has been stagnant during COVID.

pros:

cons:
- level of workplace satisfaction seems directly linked to what department you're in 
- furloughs possible (covid-related)

pros: great people who were not leaders

pros: Students generally are enthusiastic about their classes. Can usually work with your department chair to get the schedule you desire. Adjunct work is good if you desire part time work and flexibility.
cons:
Widener would hire an adjunct in a heartbeat over a full time or tenured faculty member to save money. While the University took steps to raise the salaries of full time faculty (not sure by how much), they pay adjuncts  a pitiful amount ($1091 per credit hour). You put so much more time in than the pay that it turns out to be peanuts. 
Human resources is a joke. You can apply for another position with all the qualifications and never get an interview. They never post salary information so you never know what to put for your salary requirements so you're negotiating against yourself.
The area of Chester isn't the best, but if you stay on campus it's OK.

review_title: Great people, excellent benefits, excellent CEO working on its problems.
pros: Widener has a lot of wonderful people working for it who are very dedicated to their jobs.  President Harris is doing a herculean job of addressing many of the problems Widener faced when he first became President in 2003, and it is a much better institution after his 11 years as president.  The job benefits are excellent.
cons: The economic downturn affected Widener significantly, as it did all institutions of higher education.  Lack of money has hampered this institution in terms of operating funds and salaries, and this can be discouraging.  This is partially made up for by the president's approach of highly valuing employees and their contributions.  However, there always seems to be a lack of money to do some of the innovative projects that could happen at this university to make it a better place.

job_title: Campus Safety Supervisor in Brookhaven, PA
pros: The diversity of the campus community, along with the surrounding community, make Widener a dynamic place to grow and hone your skills. The mantra of being a service oriented institution translates well throughout all departments.
cons: Pay could be better, with more room for advancement.

job_title: Student Research Assistant in Chester, PA
pros: The BEST way to gain experience while getting a college degree. You can apply what you learn in class directly to your research. It is a great way to gain experience to put on your resume.
cons: It's difficult to find a balance with classes, sports, extracurriculars, and other activities and then have more time to do research.

review_title: it's a job not a career
job_title: Campus Safety Officer in Chester, PA
pros: easy job, uniforms provided, possibility to earn a degree
cons: boring and repetitive, no raises this year. favortism
